intro: Cymbalaria pseudoelatine, commonly known as the common soldierblume, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Primulaceae. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, disturbed soils across Europe and parts of Asia. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers in shades of pink or white. It is often found in meadows, along roadsides, and in other open, sunny habitats. Due to its adaptability, it is considered a common weed in many regions.
